text: The Mirror, 1911. Frank Markham Skipworth (1854 in Castor, Lincolnshire – 1929 in London) was an English portrait painter. He painted also genre and historical subjects. He studied for two years at the Lincoln School of Art, then under Edward Poynter at the Royal Academy Schools for three years and became a pupil of Adolphe William Bouguereau in Paris.http://www.wilnitsky.com/scripts/redgallery1.dll/details?No=26480 Boris Wilnitsky Fine Art ==References== Category:1854 births Category:1929 deaths Category:19th-century English painters Category:English male painters Category:20th-century English painters
title: Frank Markham Skipworth
